By sleeping in the area, we exceeded this limit and had to pay for the journey from Lisbon to the border. It's not the domain's fault, and therefore for me 5*

title: (2965) Marateca - 33 Rua Herois do Ultramar
description: The place is in the middle of town, it is a large area, relatively quiet and with little traffic. Just a faint noise from the nearby main road. There is gymnastics equipment and a playground. No shaded parking but shaded seating. Garbage disposal available. The entire parking lot is illuminated, so it is very bright in the evenings.

title: (7050) Ciborro - Largo do Povo
description: Small public parking, leveled and illuminated, on upper top of “Largo do Povo” square in CIBORRO village, 50m away from road EN 2. Parking free on evening and night, usually, enough for 2 or 3 motorhomes. Quiet during night. It lies 100m away from iconic km 500 of tourist road track EN 2 and associated bar/restaurant. There is also fuel station on the road and small dam (= “barragem”). Dam is 1,5 km away by good gravel road; nice to a very quiet night and stars watching. Public toilets, clean, 250m to S (in small blue&white garden).

title: (7050) São Cristóvão - 38.490760, -8.315793
description:
Countryside small farm, family friendly and very cosy. Safe and quiet.
The owners are young farmers who are also campers. 
Drinkable water is available. Wastewater and black water drainage available. 
4G internet coverage
The farm is very close to the picturesque village of São Cristóvão where you can take advantage of the local gastronomy, secular church and hiking grounds.
Situated halfway between Montemor o Novo and Alcácer do Sal taking the road N253.

title: (2985) Canha - N10

Espaço muito tranquilo, pode pernoitar à beira de água, aos fins-de-semana com mais movimento com desportos náuticos, ideal para relax e muito espaço para picnic. Óptimo para as crianças brincarem e andar de bicicleta.
Very quiet space, you can spend the night at the water's edge, on weekends with more movement with water sports, ideal for relaxing and plenty of space for picnics. Great for kids to play and ride a bike.

name: Quinta Lusco-Fusco
title: (2890) Quinta Lusco-Fusco
description: Quinta Lusco-Fusco is a private rural farm lets stay overnight for travelers by van, tent, bike, backpack, camping under the stars, in the shade of the cork oak, listening to the birds, seeing the farm animals. It is just 30 minutes from Lisbon. Only cold shower. Call before arrival.

title: (2910) Setúbal - 276 Estrada de Santo Ovídio Mourisca
title_short: (2910) Setúbal - 276 Estrada de Santo Ovídio Mourisca
description: Parking the football field, quiet and other features of the tide mill, watch the mill close very soon.

name: Pacha Mama Community
title: (7580-305) Pacha Mama Community
description:
We are the PachaMama community and we would love to welcome you to our cozy little farm. 
We have everything you need including toilets, hot showers, wifi, chill-out zone with games, and a fully equipped kitchen. 

On Saturdays, we host an all-you-can-eat Pizza Party and you are very welcome to join!


There are a lot of animals and dogs on the farm and you are welcome to bring your own pet. 
We have a canal that runs through our 
property where you can cool off in the fresh water in the summer time. We also have a yoga dome with daily yoga classes.

There are two ways to reach us; either from the main road, or the other road crossing the small village of Bairro da 
Quintinha. NEVER take the road that crosses the village, it is very sandy and there is a great risk of getting stuck! Instead, turn right off the main road just before IC1. 

We look forward to welcoming you! :))

name: Área Serviço Autocaravanas da Erra
title: (2100) Área Serviço Autocaravanas da Erra
description: Installation specially designed for motorhomes. Part of an outdoor "pay" parking network. Check the website on the information board at the entrance. Google will probably take you down a dirt road with a narrow bridge. Suggest finding an alternate route if you have a large vehicle. On the edge of a quiet village.

name: Quinta das Kopas
title: (2955-252) Quinta das Kopas
description:
Check-in 12:00-21:00     |    Check-out 7h30-14h00

Quinta das Kopas is a little private rural farm where you can stay in the middle of the fruit trees.
Excellent location to visit Lisbon as it is only 30 minutes from Lisbon by train. The station is just 2 km away and we will drop you off and pick you up for free.
We have facilities such as hot water showers, toilets, place to wash dishes, barbecue, washing machine, washing line, a gym and a living room (with tv and board games), as well as places to dump and refill water (only for those who sleep on the farm).
There is also a small warm salt water pool, about 33º (different hours for adults and children) and a jacuzzi if you really want to get completely relaxed.
You can also rest, read, listen to music or even sleep on the hammocks or in other seating and lying areas of our garden. But if your idea is to be a little more active, you can play our outdoor games.
Sociable pets are welcome (free of charge) but must always be on a leash and cannot be in the common interior spaces (vaccination card required).
We also have a mobile home for travelers without a motorhome or friends of our guests.
Quinta das Kopas was designed to welcome friends from different countries who want to take a break from their journey and enjoy Portuguese nature and hospitality.
Please come with google maps to make it easier to reach the gate. It is on a dead-end street and is the first gate on the left with the nameplate on the wall. (Attention: waze does not bring you to the gate).
Please check prices.

Reservation is not mandatory, but if you really want to secure your place, it would be better to get in touch with us because our capacity is per person.

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: Parking site Cromeleques de Almendres. Free parking, menhirs nearby, dirt road to access but drivable. Arrived at night preferably, surrounding cork oak forest.

view to inlet beaches and palmela castel. playground just down a sidestreet.

title_short: (2910-848) Setúbal - 52 Rua do Vale de Chaves

There are about 3 curbside parkingplaces on the edge of a park belonging to a school. Also a few larger other parking spots. Calm view, nice for the dog if you have one. Quiet on weekends. Might not be when school is on, although the school entrance is away from it and they have big parking lot. Nothing special but quiet place to get some work done, sleep and have breakfast.

title: (7490-225) Mora - 6 Rua da Estação
description: The museum car park was the only straight car park I found in Mora. There is a small parking lane parallel to the road just in front of the entrance of the museum (that's where I parked) and about 15-20 parking spaces across the road, which can be used with a not too long van. Since the campsite I drove to was closed, I also parked here. No problems and quiet (until the neighbor's rooster started crowing). There is a café on the right at the end of the museum, waste bins and a small park behind the museum.

title: (7000) Vale Maria -
description: Place at a megalithic tomb. Very quiet.

title: (7000-222) Nossa Senhora de Guadalupe - 1 Beco das Lavadeiras
title_short: (7000-222) Nossa Senhora de Guadalupe - 1 Beco das Lavadeiras
description: Public toilets including showers, in the town of Guadalupe. Not far from the track to the menhirs and the "interpretation station" Open this February, I don't know if it was open in winter

name: Camping Vasco da Gama
title: () Camping Vasco da Gama
description: It is a natural permanent campsite where people live all year round. The rear part in the pine forest is reserved for tourists. Motorhome, mobile home, caravan or tent Pitch of your choice. Everything is fenced, the gate is closed from 00:00. Until then arrival is possible. You pay 24 hours. Disposal of chemical toilets is possible. Super clean sanitary facilities, but no glasses or paper. The water in the shower is very hot and flows continuously. In summer there is a swimming pool. There is a small private animal park with poultry, a pond and a garden. There are picnic areas and additional barbecue areas. Pets are allowed.

title: (7490) Mora - Rua do Barco
description: River beach of Mora, fishing possible, swimming in summer, picnic table, barbecue. Quiet, calm by the river. To avoid in rainy weather because not tarred. Accessible to all sizes of motorhome.

title: (2910-725) Setúbal - 11C Rua Engenheiro Ferreira Dias
description: Petrol stadion with LPG

title: (2955-058) Palmela - 99 Rua Lagoa da Palha

title: (7040) Arraiolos - N251

title: (7490) Pavia - N251

title: (2120-194) Foros de Salvaterra -

title: (2900-209) Setúbal - 23 C Estrada Algodeia

title: (7580) Comporta -

name: ESA (Estação de Serviço Autocaravanas)
title: (7490) ESA (Estação de Serviço Autocaravanas)
description: ESA (Estação de Serviço Autocaravanas). Close to the Mora fluviario. Small campsite with all amenities and service area for motorhomes.

title: (7490) Cabeção -
description: Nice plateau for motorhomes separated from the campsite with the possibility of emptying and filling up with water. Very friendly caretaker, speaks a little French but very good in English. Very calm place.

title: (7040) Arraiolos -
description: Abandoned train station, now an ecopist with picnic area, flat area with some shade from pine trees, noise in background from main road but very quiet at night. Great for a walk along the old railway line.

title: (2870) Montijo - E90
description: Parking at the Forum Montijo shopping center. With all the facilities of a shopping center a few steps away (like the Continente supermarket and pharmacies).

title: (2900-412) Setúbal - 281 Avenida Luísa Todi
description:
Online parking, in a very crowded area, and close to a police station.
Like the entire center of Setúbal, it is payable with a parking meter from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. the price is €3.20 every 4 hours. It is attached to the entire interesting area, and it has given me more security than other nearby car parks that appeared in the area.

title: (7570) - 8 N253-1
description: Stop next to the road. There are many along the way but this one at least allows you to get a few meters and not be at the foot of the asphalt. Perfect for a quiet stop (eat, rest, stretch legs ...). Behind the dunes it seems that there is the beach.

title: (2900-412) Setúbal - 1 Rua João de Deus
description: Stop for the night. Free from 7:00 p.m. to 9:00 a.m., during the day you have to pay at the parking machine. We used it to spend the night because it gave us security to be right in front of the fire brigade. On the whole avenue nice restaurants. It's noisy at night, we stopped here to catch the ferry to Troia the next morning.

title: (2951-901) Palmela - E90
description: Picnic area with toilets and a shower.

title: () Palmela - E1
description:
Typical gas station along the highway, free hot showers in the building behind the shop,
ask for a key in the shop (in exchange for a passport).

title: () Alcochete - 237 N119
description: Close by night! Hyper ample free parking hyper Freeport shopping center. Without service.

title: (2900-464) Setúbal - 357 Avenida Luísa Todi
description: Level parking with enough space for a 6 meter van. Payment is made from Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. and on Saturdays from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. Overnight stays are allowed. It is close to the beach and different restaurants, both local food and pubs. Highly recommended to spend the night.

title: (7580) - Unnamed Road
description: I stood here for a couple of hours. But it shouldn't be a problem even at night. Off-road. Well suited for transit. You can stand there pretty well anywhere. Just drive around a bit.

title: (2900-616) Setúbal - 20 Rua E do Bairro João Ferreira
title_short: (2900-616) Setúbal - 20 Rua E do Bairro João Ferreira
description: Unpaved square for parking by residents. The camper is tolerated. Dirty place (dog droppings) but quiet and close to the center. For shorter motorhomes only.

address.street: 20 Rua E do Bairro João Ferreira

title: (2900) Setúbal - 94 Avenida José Mourinho
description: We have parked here and spent the night without any problem.

title: (2890) Alcochete - Estrada das Hortas
description: It is an abandoned nature interpretation center. It has utilities and water that can be used. It is a quiet and safe neighborhood. There is a bar next to the water. Do not enter the dirt road high risk of getting stuck.

title: (7000) Nossa Senhora de Guadalupe -
description: Vineyard where 1 fully self-sufficient camper/mobile home can be parked for a maximum of 24 hours. You pay for a product and can then camp for free next to the vineyard.

title: (2900-597) Setúbal -
description: We spent one night in that parking lot, it is indicated that it is for professional fishermen, but another person with a van asked the police and they said that nothing was wrong. We were in total 3 Spanish vans and a whole day. There are quite a few people who go with their cars to see the sea at night and in the morning all kinds of people park up to go to the beach next door. We were a daily day and there are places to dine and others. I recommend it 100%.

title: (2900-597) Setúbal - 5A Travessa Saboaria
description: Place where I spent the night and where there are usually more motorhomes and cars. Quiet and with good restaurants nearby.

title: (2900) Setúbal - 22 Rua Hermínia Silva
description: Free public parking in setubal. For the day only

title: (2900-579) Setúbal - 22 N10-4
description: Two water taps possibly allowing the filling of containers. it is along the beach and therefore quite frequent but it can help out.

title: (7490) Cabeção - Unnamed Road
description: Flat land in the forest on a paved road, a little deformed by tree roots but widely practicable by all types of vehicles. This path stops at the level of a house that seems abandoned or perhaps a second home ... Very quiet, I was able to fall asleep with songs of locusts and / or cicadas in the distance. In the middle of the night, an animal came to pay me a visit around surely a hare; which woke me up but nothing bad. Thanks to this little stealthy alarm clock, I could hear an owl or an owl that was flying in the distance. And in the morning, it was very nice to wake up with different bird songs .. I highly recommend !!!

title: (2900-579) Setúbal - 122A Avenida José Mourinho
description: Online parking in front of the Rockalot (beach bar). It is next to the GNR headquarters so no problem. Beach 15 meters away and Setúbal center 15 minutes walk. We spent 2 nights and terrific

title: (2900-300) Setúbal - Estr. do Castelo de São Filipe
title_short: (2900-300) Setúbal - Estr. do Castelo de São Filipe
description: Place to park right before the castle, up to 8m of length should not be a problem

address.street: Estr. do Castelo de São Filipe

title: (2900) Setúbal - Estrada do Castelo de São Filipe
title_short: (2900) Setúbal - Estrada do Castelo de São Filipe
description: Parking of Sao Filipe Castle. many visitors during the day. very nice visit of the castle possible and free but with superb view on setubal.

address.street: Estrada do Castelo de São Filipe

title: (2900-322) Setúbal - 226 Rua Batalha do Viso
description: We travel in a minivan camper car, so we always look for places a little far from the center. This place is in a residential area, only neighbors walked with dogs, very nice! We came in the middle of August and there weren't many people, yes, it is in front of some schools, maybe in other months there would be more people.

title: (7580) Comporta - 4 Rua das Salinas
description: Great parking lot in a nice little village. 5 minutes by car to the beach. In the town there are many bars and restaurants which are all great and the prices are completely ok (not overrun with tourists). Parked our van here and had a great evening and slept very well afterwards.

title: (7490) Cabeção - Unnamed Road
description: Cool place, near a road. Super quite. Great place to see the sunrise and sunset

title: (7580-649) Comporta - 6 Rua de São Pedro
description: Ample parking for AC at the back of town next to the sports center. Quiet and shaded in the afternoon.

title: (7490) Pavia - 47 Rua de Santo António
description: Ideal for a meal stop there is everything you need garbage water and something to entertain the children the toilets are a little higher on the right looking at the area

title: (7580-643) Comporta - 8 Rua do Galeão
description:
Hardware store where you can buy
 gas bottle 907 (the blue one) among many other things. One of the few in the area.
Very good deal.

title: (7580) Comporta - 49 Rua das Oliveiras
description: Large parking spaces suitable for motorhomes, at the bottom of a housing estate and close to a natural area. Very quiet and safe. Possibility to spend the night without problem. A few minutes walk from the city center of Comporta.

title: (7580) Comporta - 31 Rua 25 de Abril
description: Ample parking area with shade at the ends. The beautiful beach of Comporta is 10 minutes by bike, 25 minutes on foot. Potable water, sewage, emptying cassette available free of charge. Very quiet day and night, it is close to the GNR.

title: (7490) Pavia - 78 Rua 25 de Abril
description: A place surrounded by nature on the banks of a very pleasant and easily accessible river. On the other side of the shore you can see bulls. It is a fishing spot but there is none today. possibility to go further on the way.

title: (7490) - Unnamed Road
description: Easy access place for motorhome, with the beautiful river where you can bath. There are some picnic areas and a grill. It was very quiet to sleep as there is little traffic

title: (7490) Pavia - 21 Rua de Aviz
description: Pavia viewpoint (= “Miradouro”) with 2 picnic tables aside impressive very olive tree; and others around. I arrived with 7,5m motorhome but transit inside streets can recommend shorter vehicles.

title: (2130) Benavente - N118
description: Lavanteria, wash and dry at intermarche.

title: (2135-322) Samora Correia - 144 Rua dos Operários Agrícolas
title_short: (2135-322) Samora Correia - 144 Rua dos Operários Agrícolas
description: LPG station. Easy access, but mind the 2 meter awning. No self-service so check opening hours.

title: (7490) Pavia -
description: Beautiful spot by the river, just off the main road. Spot for fishing. You can hear the road but it’s not too busy.

name: O Torricado
title: (2135) O Torricado
description: Restaurant and cafe with truck parking. We asked to stay the night and they agreed it’s ok. The showers are available.

title: (2130) Benavente - 5 Rua Álvaro Rodrigues de Azevedo
title_short: (2130) Benavente - 5 Rua Álvaro Rodrigues de Azevedo
description: Free Park, could park the motorhome No water or WC. The near station is at Intermarché Benavente 2 km from here
